A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 38 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 [Lusca](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1010) **Source** [Pathfinder #161: Belly of the Black Whale](/Sources.aspx?ID=51) pg. 83 **Perception** +31; blood scent, [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 100 feet **Languages** [Aquan](/Languages.aspx?ID=14), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +34, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +30, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +31 **Str** +9 **Dex** +5 **Con** +9 **Int** +0 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +5 **Blood Scent** The lusca can smell blood in the water up to 1 mile away. --- **AC** 40 **Fort** +32 **Ref** +26 **Will** +29 **HP** 320 **Immunities** electricity **[All-Around Vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=1)**
**Storm Bringer** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) When the lusca is near the surface for more than 1 hour, clouds appear and deliver a thunderstorm with a 2-mile radius centered on its location. The weather returns to normal 1 hour after the lusca departs.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** The lusca gains 2 extra reactions at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with its jaws. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action. --- **Speed** 10 feet, swim 50 feet **Melee** jaws +35 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+17 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** tentacle +35 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+17 bludgeoning plus lusca venom **Primal Innate Spells** DC 38 - **8th** [Punishing Winds](/Spells.aspx?ID=240) (×3) - **9th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33) (×3) **Capsize** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) The lusca tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the lusca) or the pilot's [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) DC, whichever is higher. **Lusca Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** Fortitude DC 38; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 4d6 poison damage and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) (1 round); **Stage 2** 6d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round) **Ravenous Jaws** The lusca makes three jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the lusca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the lusca makes all of these attacks. If the lusca subsequently uses the [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Ravenous Jaws. **[Rend](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=30)** jaws **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Huge, 4d12+9 bludgeoning, Rupture 38
Blue Holes Luscas frequently lurk in blue holes— marine sinkholes that descend far below the surrounding sea bottom and connect to flooded subterranean passages or deeper into the Darklands. For all their might, however, luscas don't dominate these lightless realms. Rather, they are but one of many types of crafty and titanic sea monsters, from the more-familiar [aboleths](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2) and [krakens](/Monsters.aspx?ID=275) to bizarre hybrids of whales, eels, and cuttlefish.
